list_definition.definition: a cloth etc tied under a child’s chin to catch spilt food etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The baby was wearing a bib.

list_definition.mean_english: phần trên của cái tạp dề
list_definition.definition: the top part of an apron or overalls, covering the chest.

list_ex_of_english: Some of the guests then passed out, others were sick into their bibs and a few made it home, their thingumajigs unable to rise to the occasion.
We found the bones of the burial with the bib-head pendant in a small, disar ticulated pile covered by a cajete placed face down.
I will not apologise for going from buttons and bows and hairslides and bibs to garden furniture.
After all, a kilt and a bib-and-brace overall can scarcely be described as interchangeable.
They were showcased as a cute, fresh-faced folk duo dressed in bib overalls.
Players initials are to be included on both the front and back of the bibs.
We shall be told that we are not wearing our bibs next !
Both faces have chin straps or bib motifs.
